result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:16 PM (64-05) Defendant Abraham T. Scull in court.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Abraham T. Scull.  Attorney Samuel Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Lochowicz acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.

2:19 PM
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in court. ADA Ten Haken appears for the State of Wisconsin. Petition for court appointed attorney; granted. Defendant does not need to reimburse at this time, may change in the future. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Abraham T. Scull in court. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. MFAC to be filed. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Abraham T. Scull in court. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): DARLENE MCLEMORE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-2479

Defendant Abraham T Scull in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared for bond purposes only. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
